title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: " Ugh ! don't let's quarrel," interposed Barney Flynn. " Is it to be Blacket Place or Lauder Road ? "

title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: " It's lonely, and there would be few about; but there's not so much to lift. For a good haul, I say No. — Blacket Place." "All right, you're the best judge.

title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: "All right, you're the best judge. Let it be Blacket Place; we may try the other again. How are we to get in?"

title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: I sha'n't keep ye at all unless ye give the word. I give ye your choice : Will ye go to the Office and be locked up for helping to plan the robbery at Blacket Place, or wait here till the morning and go free ? " " Betrayed !" hoarsely exclaimed the other. " Who has done it ? "

title: Brought to Bay; or, Experiences of a City Detective
author: Macgovan, James.
snippet: This, too, was amicably arranged, and the two sat down to pass the night. Meanwhile I had made my way to Blacket Place with other three men, and snugly ensconced myself in the room, with the shutters ajar. It was a long, weary wait; for we had to be there a good bit before twelve, to make sure of no blunder.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Blacket Place was a leafy enclave of Georgian mansions hidden between the bustle of Newington Street and the student chaos of Pollock Halls. The Neighbourhood Watch signs were brass plaques, CCTV everywhere, and Billy's ancient Micra was making curtains twitch.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: Each speed bump made his head rattle as the taxi turned into Blacket Place. Heavy oaks leaned over garden walls, lights were on above ornate front doors.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: He turned into Blacket Place. Dark, quiet.

title: Hit and Run
author: Johnstone, Doug
snippet: The men watched until they reached the car. They got in, drove round the corner and stopped for five minutes, then headed back to Blacket Place, parking further away from the house. The guys were gone.
